title: Simulated Futures Debated
outcome: A suppressed subroutine in the BCI quietly unlocks citywide: Halden's concealed civic simulations. On public displays, citizens watch alternate versions of recent years—where Halden lived, or the Directorate seized total control, or the free zones failed. Neighborhoods debate which path to take, using the simulations as a guide for future policy. Street gatherings transform into participatory forums where everyone votes on which vision of Stenograd they want to realize. The process leads to a collective reckoning with Halden's legacy—not as an answer, but as a catalyst for real self-government.

events.description: BCI screens across Stenograd activate Halden's hidden simulations, showing alternate city histories shaped by different key choices and events.
Neighborhood forums and free zone councils organize public screenings and debates of the simulated futures, drawing massive participation.
Citizens begin voting on preferred policy directions derived from the simulations, influencing local governance and coordination.
Divergent neighborhoods experiment with alternative models: some follow a decentralized mutual-aid route while others cautiously restore aspects of central oversight.
After several intense weeks of debate and participatory decision-making, the city settles into a new equilibrium—Halden's legacy reframed as a foundation for pluralistic, self-chosen paths.
